title: Gandhi circle is big circle
review: IThe Gandhi circle is big circle and centre point of the city nearMandir palace. The Gandhi statue is quite god. The adjacent Gandhi emporium is ordinary in good building The place is suitable for snacks etc and you can contact several traveling agents. The Gandhi market near this circle have all type of shops as every where.

title: Too many cows and motorbikes
review: If the cows and motorbikes could be diverted to parallel streets maybe the businesses here could enjoy more passing trade. As it is, you're constantly on the lookout for cow poop, speeding motorbikes and snarling dogs. Not a pleasant relaxing shopping experience.

title: Very crowded
review: This is very old street and very crowded street. Lots of small shops selling variety of stuff. Nothing interesting

title: Quintessential view of India
review: Walk down this street with care. Motorbikes, tuktuks and cows all vie for the small space. It is a good microcosm of Indian life. Keep looking down or you will need a shoe cleaner

title: Average
review: It’s ok. Just a normal Indian street with lots of stalls and even more touts trying to get as much money out of tourists as possible.

title: step in to this maze and step back in time, (and cow dung more than likely)
review: this is India!

title: A Crowded Street
review: The Gandhi Chowk street is basically a crowded market place with small shops lined on either side of the street. It is definitely not a tourist attraction and need not be added as a must place to visit on ones itinerary.

title: Interesting
review: Gandhi chowk and related names are available in many cities. We took photos much and this is real photographs and scenes we took of Jaisalmer.

title: Feel the experience
review: Narrow and busiest street in city center, where you can find all kind of shops, watch out for the scooters, bikes, cars and like any other place in India, cows and street dogs.

title: Gandhi Chowk
review: A main road junction near the market place good for shopping souvenirs and other items. Has a variety of shops. Bandhej, handicrafts etc.

title: Just like any other crowded dirty street in India
review: Park your car at Gandhi Circle / For parking and take a walk here. Narrow congested streets have lot of shops for shopping. Eat Mirchi wada / Pyaz Kachori at any hotel.

title: Like so many other Streets... not sure why its listed
review: This street is like so many other streets in Jaisalmer that I am not sure why it is listed separately.  However, saying that.... you will probably cross this street if you are staying a couple of days... its busy and crazy and full of food shops and markets and pigs and cows etc... you probably will walk it without knowing its anywhere special.

title: why you visit this? its not an attraction..
review: Its not a attraction point.. its just a street for local market, fruit seller and vegetable market.. also a taxi stand.. crowded with lots of cows and other animal and street vendor.. full of cow dung..:-(

title: In a very bad state.
review: The city of jaisalmer is not at all maintained by the officials.

title: Typical Indian market area
review: We wandered around here one evening after dinner.  The shops etc are average I didn't notice anything of particular interest but it was an insight into local life.

title: Local market for local people.
review: Following centuries of trading this traditional market sells the fruit, vegetables and goods required by the inhabitants of the fort. As such many vows wander the area feeding on the scraps left by the traders and customers.

title: Watch where you tread!
review: This is a very busy shopping street so if it's shops you need this is where they are. But, this is shopping on the edge of the desert not in a city centre and appears to be mostly aimed at the local market plus tourist "stuff".

title: Market
review: The market is very good. You can weave easily through these alleys filled with shops offering an array of goods from local to from away.

title: Shops galore, hard to breathe
review: We strolled past innumerable small shops where the locals purchase everything from housewares to clothing.  Biggest problems--walking feels dangerous and breathing is difficult due to the pesky, sooty motorbikes that dart everywhere with horns blaring.

title: Why is it even mentioned?
review: Nothing special about this street, usual shops selling stuff which we see in pretty much every old city. Very congested, constant blaring of horns, stray animals.

title: Lively Lane
review: A nice, lively, narrow street, easy to walk in, lots of shops. Keep going until you get to Huanaman Circle for some real people watching.

title: Foodies Chowk!!
review: This review is for all those travelers who have immense love and interest for local food. While you are in Jaisalmer, your trip is incomplete without trying the local delicacies such as Dal pakwan. Dal batti churma and kachoris have become commercialized but if you want to have authentic Rajasthani food, go to Vaishnav Chowk (Just outside the fort enterance) in the main market during morning (before 11 am). You will find 2 stalls on the street crowded for super delicious dal pakwan (crisp thin pizza base topped with yellow dal, onion, chilles, and cutneys) and fascinating kachoris (stuffed poori's with variety of chutneys). You can then go to the Bhatia sweet shop to relish a local sweet called Gowtua.

title: Jaisalmer's city centre
review: This Chowk is located such that one essentially has to cross. He may or may not be aware of this though. All the monuments are close to this place and mandir palace hotel and tourist centre is close.

title: ENJOY STREET FOOD WITH GOOD TASTE
review: We enjoyed Masala tea at Munna Tea stall,locally famous teashop. Tea was served in Kullahds, small cups made from mud. Tea was very tasty that we repeat our order.

title: Dirty
review: The street can be disgusting at times, there is nothing special about it. Not actually sure why it is even listed.

title: best street of jaisalmer
review: this area of jaisalmer is worth watching if you are in jaisalmer. there are have many vintage properties which is  worth watching . the palace of royal family of jaisalmer is also situated in this area. this are is also famous for local shopping. many local art shops can be seen in this area. reputated antique dealer are along the street of gandhi chowk. well known shop jaisamer handloom is also situated in this area. the best hotels of jaisalmer are also based here. trio and saffron serves the best food.

title: great interesting area
review: There is a really good little hotel here that is suitable for backpackers, travellers and solo female travellers.  The location is good and within easy walking distance of good local restaurants and the bazaar.  Area is usual for India - full of life, chaos,  litter, wandering pigs, chickens, goats and cows.  Lots of cheap Tuk Tuks available for the inevitable ride up to Jaisalmer Fort.   Expect to be hassled to visit shops / majic carpet stores / women's co-operatives and offerings of guides and camel safaris.     A vibrant place.

title: A busy and typical commercial street in Jaisalmer ...
review: "Gandhi Chowk Street" is one of the most busy and typical streets of the "Golden City" of Jailsamer! Located at the very heart of the Sadar Bazar area and near Hanuman Circle Road, it attracts a whole crowd every day! Typical shops, street food, souvenir vendors and beautiful "havelis" (the old sandstone carved mansions with intricate latticework) will catch your attention. Watch carefully your steps (as it is not clean at all) and beware of cows and goats wandering around this narrow street! "Gandhi Chowk Street" will certainly surprise you, with all its colors, smiles and scents - the unforgettable Rajasthan's soul and high spirits! Enjoy!

title: Many eateries in this area
review: This is one of the busiest place in Jaisalmer. There are many eateries to satisfy your taste buds. You can also buy many antique items in the shop here.

title: Everything is here
review: It is just a small area, but you can find everything here such as tour operator, money exchange, restaurants, hostels, cheap guesthouse etc.

title: Overrated !! But you can get something nice
review: I was here last month and many of my pal suggested me that Gandhi Chowk Street is something which will see. Well yeah as my hotel was here. Now as compare to other Rajasthan markets like the one in Jodhpur or pink city market in Jaipur Gandhi Chowk Street is comparably small.

title: evening stroll
review: great to fo this in the late afternoon early evening, nut only worth 15-20mins of you're time. can be missed if run out of time

title: cows, cows and more cows!!
review: this street has lots of shops, restaurants and houses. Its full of cows. You can find some very interesting shops with a  lot of antiques for reasonable price.

title: Local market
review: This is a market for local everyday shopping.

title: Very good
review: I visited Gandhi chowk in feb2015.it is busy market area with little shops.I purchased 2  Jaisalmer named T shirts for the memory of jaisalmer visit.

title: Buy Everything Here
review: busy streets with busy shops, you can by good stuff with good price and yes you can see many cows wondering here and there.

title: Busy street
review: Busy street with a lot of small shops. Very crowded with people and of course Cattle. On the way to everywhere in Jaisalmer. Cannot miss it if you are visiting the city

title: narrow and dirty
review: narrow dirty street in city centre with cows walking around, you need to dodge scooters but can pick up some sovenirs and tie and die material etc

title: Good place to enjoy local delicacies
review: The market below Jaisalmer fort is good to  enjoy local delicacies. we had enjoyed Panipuri, Chaach, Bhelpuri there. the quality is good any buy at a hygienic place. A swwet shop namely "Dhanraj Ranmal Bhatia" is a must visit and "Ghotve ke Laddu" are very unique in taste and rare to see/have. Other sweets are also good at this shop.

title: All the Havelis and Fort are very Close from Gandhi Chowk.
review: All the major attractions are pretty close from here. You can easily walk and see all the major attractions like Mandir Palace, Nathmal ji Haveli, Patwa Haveli, Golden Fort etc.

title: good shopping
review: loved wandering around here and doing some shopping. good to see so many fresh fruit and vege stalls. loved this place.

title: Atmospheric and a great place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: We were fortunate enough to be staying in a Haveli just off Gandhi Chowk Street. Close to the Fortress, with wonderful views of the Fortress we enjoyed exploring Gandhi Chowk with it's markets and stalls - less touristy than the Fortress area, yet very close by, it was a nice contrast to it. Well worth an explore.

title: pathetic, filthy, dirty
review: nothing at all for the tourists...except the cattles on the road, dirt, stinking smell. Pani puri in jaisalmer is a complete no no. market inside the fort are much better to shop.

title: Filthy
review: Extremely dirty place to visit with no sign of cleanliness. There's hardly anything that would pull you to visit the chowk.

title: Lots of local  color - great photo ops
review: A typical market selling bits and pieces of everything.

title: Crowded Main Place
review: This chowk is the heart of Jaisalmer. With shops and eating joints surrounding this place, you will always come here when you are in this town. Hanuman Chowk near it is also another busy place here.

title: Local Market
review: you can find local hand made goods ,lots of small small food shop is there , you must eat local kacohri and mirchi bada its very delicious

title: The real Rajasthan Streets
review: Going to the place i felt like this is the real streets of Rajasthan.

title: Gandhi chowk.
review: Nice place,, a bit congested but good for local shopping. Easy to reach from fort..Good variety available for rajasthani dreses.

title: Main spot in Market
review: This is actually Gandhi Chowk..not Ganhi Chowk. This is the main chowk of the jaisalmer and heart of the city. A no. of main Heritage Hotels including the hotel of the king of Jaisalmer are located at this place. Good to roam here and there in the evening

title: good experiance
review: one must visit if time permits only otherwise its just wastage of time for Indians its a local market  and for tourists a place to cut there pockets

title: Actually it's Gandhi Chowk! A great slice of chaos, worth a walk.
review: Worth a wander to see Indian life in all its aspects, shops of all sorts plus a bloke (shoe repairer) sitting on the floor near the fruit market who fixed a pair of broken flip-flops for us. Typical Indian chaos, lovely. Steve Riches, Northampton, UK.

title: Worth visiting here
review: You will like this place for street shopping. Buy something Rajasthani from this area. You need to do hard negotiations to get better bargain. Instead find out fixed rate shops which are available and "Fixed Rate" mentioned on such shop.

title: The hustle and bustle of Jaisalmer!
review: Tons of shops and restaurants. Friendly crowd - felt completely safe walking through the streets, even when we needed directions to a restaurant of shop!

title: Main spot in Market for Shopping
review: You will like this place for street shopping. Buy something Rajasthani from this area. You need to do hard negotiations to get better bargain. One must visit if time permits only otherwise its just wastage of time for Indians its a local market and for tourists a place to cut there pockets

title: Authentic Jaisalmer
review: Plenty of small shops and street stalls in this street, together with animals and motorbikes: certainly pays to watch where you are going! Not too much hassle from the merchants. Worth a look as you meander around Jaisalmer town.

title: Simple lanes...simple people
review: Peaople in Jaisalmer are just so simple, kimd hearted and indeed so helpful. Their mannerism just blew out minds away. Gandhi Chowk street is the place we met most of the people of Jaisalmer

title: OK
review: This is one of the busiest circle in Jaisalmer. You will find some restaurants to eat. You will find shops which sell you footware and clothes. There is a petrol pump near by which is helpful.

title: Chaotic
review: Chaotic with tuk tuks, cars, cows, goats, pigs, people, motorbikes, bicycles and so much more.  It's brain overload walking up this street but part of the India attraction!!!

title: A hub of the city outside the fortress.  Some good restaurants.
review: This area is nothing special in itself, but there are several very nice restaurants here.

title: Energetic, vibrant bazaar area
review: Fantastic place to wander. Hectic, busy & often crowded, but it's a great place to do a bit of local shopping, or just wander around taking in the amazing sights, sounds & smells. Get something to eat whilst there. The locals are friendly & helpful, and unlike some other market/bazaar/shopping areas around the World, it is a very non intimidating atmosphere. Went for regular walks through the area - there is always something new to discover!

title: Shops, shops and more shops!
review: A good place to bargain for all those things you've never thought about buying, try Jai Laxmi Handicraft near the Patwa Haveli, good for cheap Indian shirts, ladies clothes and tie dyed scarfs etc. She'll even get you a cup of tea!

title: Can find some treasures or get taken for a ride
review: You can find some special treasures and high quality local products on Gandhi Chowk but beware of touts (even if you are in the process of purchasing a plastic mirror) who want to offer "help" and high prices. Shopkeepers are used to tourists with a lot of money and not a lot of time or experience bargaining; and they take advantage of it. Best to know what you want and how much it should cost- and if you're going to Pushkar do most of your souvenir shopping there.That being said, I know the shopmen are just trying to make a living like everyone else and the tourist season is short.

title: poor
review: very dirty place and disappointing for a tourist visit .... the place is quite filty and is more like a bazaar in a shabby neighbourhood, can be avoided

title: fun
review: Bargain here! 50% or more from original price.. but don't go alone, make sure you have a friend with you, or if after dark, a man friend

title: Enjoyable and not pushy...
review: Nice shops and easy to walk through. Nobody really pushes you to buy, Pleasant shopping and some good shops

title: Great for photography
review: The area is filled with villagers who've made their way to the market from remote locations. The men sporting turbans and white clothes and the women colourfully dressed - many with large nose rings and travelling in groups.  Didn't find anything I wanted to buy and was told that Jaisalmer may be decent for patchwork and camel leather goods but better to shop elsewhere for other goods (spices in Jodhpur, scarves in Pushkar, artwork/carvings in Udaipur, practical items in Jaipur).

title: Poor filthy marketplace with bright colors
review: The only marketplace as such in the town, its filled with filth and wet mud. There isn't much to shop for. Batik prints are a specialty, so we bought a few pyjamas and handbags (all for women) - bright and nice; priced decently. Fossil stones were too expensive, and purity was hard to identify. Lots of leather products but crude and poor stinking quality.

title: An Experience
review: The mix of people,shops, cows, bikes tuk tuks and tourists make this a memorable walk. To my eyes it seemed chaotic, but it all seemed to work with calmness, good humour and a sort of gentleness.

title: Ganhi Chowk shopping
review: Ganhi Chowk was an amazing place to shop or just look around, l found a fantastic store called Jaisalmer Handloom and Handicrafts, the men who own and run this establishment were so helpful and friendly, the variety of goods were amazing, Ganhi Chowk is worth a visit

title: A good bazaar
review: If they would only stop the damn motorbykes they are all in love with this could be an outstanding little market, with lots of nice shops, some nice leather products and cute local jewellery. As it is you risk being run over constantly and the exhaust fumes are horrible: let's hope the city council does something about it, but like in much of India motors and horns come before people :-((

title: Love the Pani Puri of Gandhi Chowk
review: :) Give 5************************** i love this street in Jaislamer very much

title: good location
review: nice to see local market life near gandhi chowk. the name Gandhi chowk is well known place for restaurant and hotels. its starting point of small jaisalmer market. from here patva ki haweli is 800 mtr .hanuman circle is 500 mtr . and fort is 01km away

title: Warts & all!
review: The local atmosphere & colour were tremendous. Eating places, takeaway stalls, market stalls, on the road stalls, shops, local craftsmen, spices, cows.......you name it it was there.  If you like mucking in with the locals you'll enjoy it

title: Loads of shops
review: Good for evening walk. Ganesh handicrafts has everything to offer however I felt it was too expensive and was cashing on its popularity

title: where locals and foreigners mix
review: it's a narrow street where it can get crowded at times. lots of activities going on around here. good place for shopping, and groceries.

title: Typical
review: A few not so bad restauranta, an open air market and access to the Historical Mandir Haveli, which actually deserves a visit.

title: Slice of India
review: A good cross section on India on the street, but with a particularly Rajasthani twist.

title: good way to get to know locals
review: nice atmosphere, good place to meet locals and just watch them doing their everyday things. Every day there is different.

title: Gandhi circle is big circle
review: IThe Gandhi circle is big circle and centre point of the city nearMandir palace. The Gandhi statue is quite god. The adjacent Gandhi emporium is ordinary in good building The place is suitable for snacks etc and you can contact several traveling agents. The Gandhi market near this circle have all type of shops as every where.

title: Typical Indian street (bazaar) scene
review: We visited Jaisalmer for three days last November and found ourselves on the Ganhi Chowk many times, just outside the Fort.  Here you can find lots of souvenir shops, consumable goods if you something of this nature, restaurants, bars, some local bakery (sweets), endless travel agents ready to sell you onward transportation arrangements and lots of little streets, alleys to walk through and enjoy.

title: Too many cows and motorbikes
review: If the cows and motorbikes could be diverted to parallel streets maybe the businesses here could enjoy more passing trade. As it is, you're constantly on the lookout for cow poop, speeding motorbikes and snarling dogs. Not a pleasant relaxing shopping experience.

title: Very crowded
review: This is very old street and very crowded street. Lots of small shops selling variety of stuff. Nothing interesting

title: Interesting
review: Gandhi chowk and related names are available in many cities. We took photos much and this is real photographs and scenes we took of Jaisalmer.

title: Quintessential view of India
review: Walk down this street with care. Motorbikes, tuktuks and cows all vie for the small space. It is a good microcosm of Indian life. Keep looking down or you will need a shoe cleaner

title: Average
review: It’s ok. Just a normal Indian street with lots of stalls and even more touts trying to get as much money out of tourists as possible.

title: step in to this maze and step back in time, (and cow dung more than likely)
review: this is India!

title: A Crowded Street
review: The Gandhi Chowk street is basically a crowded market place with small shops lined on either side of the street. It is definitely not a tourist attraction and need not be added as a must place to visit on ones itinerary.

review: IThe Gandhi circle is big circle and centre point of the city nearMandir palace. The Gandhi statue is quite god. The adjacent Gandhi emporium is ordinary in good building The place is suitable for snacks etc and you can contact several traveling agents. The Gandhi market near this circle have all type of shops as every where.
